Subject: Re: üêî Chicken group meeting 1 Jan 16 2019 @ Boom Cafe
body-plain:
Hey David,

- Very good idea to reach Callup.io !

Hey Xavier,

- How about #BrusselsTogether ?

- For our next chicken meetup
: can it be on Wednesday 13. February ?
: can it be at BeCentral, a room where we can use a beamer ?

Thank you Brussels chickens !

Jo

0466 201 245

ARDOC <http://www.facebook.com/ArdocTransnational> Reporters for Solutions

Zero Waste Cities <http://www.facebook.com/zwcities>
<http://www.facebook.com/zwcities>




Op ma 21 jan. 2019 om 16:05 schreef David Prino <david.prino@gmail.com>:

> Hello Citizens,
>
> A small question, would it be feasible and/or useful to associate with
> this platform: https://www.callup.io/ ?
>
> One of it's goal is to list all the citizens and transitions initiatives.
>
>
> On Wed, 16 Jan 2019 at 22:22, Xavier D <xavier@domain.com> wrote:
>
>> Hello chickens! üêì
>>
>> Thank you all for taking the time to meet tonight and for your
>> contributions. If you wonder about the name of the group, ask Andreea
>> ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø
>>
>> This is the first email to testgroup@citizenspring.be. This will create
>> that email group and add you all as members. It will also publish this
>> email to https://citizenspring.be/chicken
>> To start a new thread, just send an email to testgroup@citizenspring.be
>>
>> Those are the notes (summary, then rush below).
>> I apologize in advance if I mispelled your name.
>> Also adding Claude who couldn't be with us tonight.
>>
>> *Goal*: create a media of the grassroots citizen initiatives in Brussels
>> *Why*: there is no place where we can learn about all the different
>> citizen initiatives and what they are up to. What are their next event? How
>> did they start? How can I contribute?
>> *How*: following the model of Dukop.dk in Copenhagen, we want to start
>> by offering a website that lists all the events happening in Brussels in
>> the community of citizen initiatives. Ideally in multiple languages to be
>> inclusive.
>> *Next step*: meet again to better define the type of events and
>> organizations we want. Prepare that meeting by already selecting a few
>> events as examples. We also want to bring examples of new media that we
>> love that could serve as inspiration.
>>
>> *TODOS*:
>> @Manuel P <manuel@domain.com> can you share with the group the
>> directory of citizen initiatives?
>> @Jo: can you organize the next meeting in February?
>> @Xavier D <xavier@domain.com> note to myself: follow up with google
>> form to start encoding events.
>>
>>
>> *Raw notes:*
>>
>> Presents:
>> Andreea: offline/online campaigning for privacy and censorship
>> Andres: super power: video
>> David: super power: communication
>> Bogdan: hard working person. New media and new tools are being used by
>> more conservative groups. It‚Äôs sad. Want to change that and get more
>> involved.
>> Manuel: create an alternative narrative for the city to mainstream media.
>> Set up a newsroom, wikipedia style. Contribute with stories about the city.
>> Super power: project management
>> Xavier: super power: entrepreneurship, web development. Would love to see
>> a platform where everyone can contribute but with a curated / edited side
>> as a newsletter.
>> Jo: science teacher in Schaerbeek, WeBrussels, try to connect things that
>> already exist.
>> Active in Indie media when it was still active (translate dutch and
>> french), now "wereld morgen"
>> The bulletin: reaches expats in Brussels
>> Daar Daar: translate dutch articles into French
>>
>> Xavier: hybrid where everyone can submit content, but need for a
>> curated/edited version
>> Jo would love to translate articles in many languages
>> Andreea likes the idea
>>
>> We need a directory of all initiatives and their events / news.
>>
>> Manuel: already worked with Reinventing Brussels to create an inventory
>> of initiatives. Has a spreadsheet of citizen initiatives that he will share.
>>
>> David: Place to show you alternatives being developed. Inspire me, how
>> can I contribute? What events are happening?
>>
>> Andreea: In copenhagen there was a website that compiled all the events
>> from alternative left wings collectives, squats, youth houses, it was a
>> calendar, nothing more. I was checking it all the time. Everything was in
>> English. I envision this project everything around this calendar,
>> organizations should have a profile, blog posts from them. Dukop.dk
>>
>> Bogdan: StressFaktor <http://www.stressfaktor.squat.net> in Berlin
>> monthly catalogue: al the pop up kitchen, demonstrations, free food, in
>> English. Online and offline.
>> There are a few gatekeepers in brussels that know what‚Äôs going on but we
>> need to gather them.
>> Multiple languages can be confusing: translation or different content?
>> I miss the pop coolness of local media
>> Sometimes I disagree with Bruzz.
>> Mostly I disagree with Vice.
>> I‚Äôd start from the narrative, not the audience
>>
>> Andres: we need different points of views. If you want to create good
>> content you need multiple points of views. Otherwise we create bubbles of
>> people.
>> Create a platform of communication between different spheres.
>>
>> Jo: you can join an initative. In classic media it‚Äôs only initiatives
>> once they already have an audience. What is happening before an initiative
>> becomes "main stream". How can you be a participant, not just a consumer of
>> media? Would be ideal to be translated but takes a lot of work.
>>
>> Let people post in multiple languages and invite them to post it in at
>> least two languages.
>>
>> Narrative helps to make sense for people that are confused. They don‚Äôt
>> know who to look for, need orientation, what can I do?
>>
>> Andreea: Citizenship doesn‚Äôt mean left or right. There are right wing
>> citizen initiatives.
>>
>> Search for purpose
>> Call to action
>> distribute the power you create
>>
>> Give the power to the reader whether they want curation
>>
>> Bogdan
>> Interesting media in the world now:
>> Newsletters are very popular now
>> NextDraft: global news
>> The Skimm
>> Indie media: open channel, people vote
>> Huffington post: open channel, curated, op-ed, ‚Ä¶
>> Reddit
>> We are now going back to centralized, more curated. People need guidance
>> and don‚Äôt trust algorithms.
>>
>> Manuel: Open Governance process to select what gets published.
>>
>> Andreea on how to get started: You go to the events of groups that are
>> close to each other.
>> The site was advertised at the events and asked the organizers to post so
>> that the audience of other events could come too. It does only one thing
>> and does it well
>>
>> David: 95% of the events I go come from facebook. We need an alternative
>>
>> Andreea: Need to be simple. Just an exposure platform. No way to RSVP,
>> keep it simple. Just link to event page
>>
>> How is it different? Citizen initiatives
>>
>> Need tags
>> Event can be for a fee, but organization can be non profit.
>> Criteria of the organizer rather than at the event level
>>
>> Bogdan: Bottom up process. Need to start with ecosystems that are already
>> there. e.g. CinemaNova
>>
>> Andreea: Need a place to direct them too.
>> Separate entry field for an event, have 2-3 examples.
>>
>> Manuel: like the idea of a MVP. Start small. Open source. Start
>> experimenting with that thing. From discussions let emerge governance rule.
>>
>> Andres: need some informality. Add a link to Google Translate.
>> Accessibility. English, French.
>>
>> Jo: some practical tool that we can continue building
>>
>> Manuel will send the 200-300 initatives
>> Open governance that is iterative
>> living document
>>
>> Andres: let‚Äôs meet again
>>
>> David: for next time, have a draft of events, as prototype.
>> Circulate a google form to identify what‚Äôs happening in February.
>>
>> Need to discuss more what is going to be listed there?
>> Grassroots not for profit citizen initiatives
>>
>> Agenda for next time: define who we are, types of events listed.
>>
>> Bogdan: for next time, each of us should come with an example of a new
>> media we like, a mailing list, a magazine, what inspires us? What is our
>> favorite media project? I can make a few slides of few examples.

body-html:
Hey David,

- Very good idea to reach Callup.io !

Hey Xavier,

- How about #BrusselsTogether ? 

- For our next chicken meetup  
: can it be on Wednesday 13. February ?
: can it be at BeCentral, a room where we can use a beamer ?

Thank you Brussels chickens !

Jo

0466 201 245

ARDOC Reporters for Solutions

Zero Waste Cities

 



Op ma 21 jan. 2019 om 16:05 schreef David Prino <david.prino@gmail.com>:
Hello Citizens,

A small question, would it be feasible and/or useful to associate with this platform: https://www.callup.io/ ?

One of it's goal is to list all the citizens and transitions initiatives.


On Wed, 16 Jan 2019 at 22:22, Xavier D <xavier@domain.com> wrote:
Hello chickens! üêì

Thank you all for taking the time to meet tonight and for your contributions. If you wonder about the name of the group, ask Andreea ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø 

This is the first email to testgroup@citizenspring.be. This will create that email group and add you all as members. It will also publish this email to https://citizenspring.be/chicken
To start a new thread, just send an email to testgroup@citizenspring.be

Those are the notes (summary, then rush below).
I apologize in advance if I mispelled your name.
Also adding Claude who couldn't be with us tonight.

Goal: create a media of the grassroots citizen initiatives in Brussels
Why: there is no place where we can learn about all the different citizen initiatives and what they are up to. What are their next event? How did they start? How can I contribute?
How: following the model of Dukop.dk in Copenhagen, we want to start by offering a website that lists all the events happening in Brussels in the community of citizen initiatives. Ideally in multiple languages to be inclusive.
Next step: meet again to better define the type of events and organizations we want. Prepare that meeting by already selecting a few events as examples. We also want to bring examples of new media that we love that could serve as inspiration.

TODOS:
@Manuel P can you share with the group the directory of citizen initiatives?
@Jo: can you organize the next meeting in February?
@Xavier D note to myself: follow up with google form to start encoding events.


Raw notes:

Presents:
Andreea: offline/online campaigning for privacy and censorship
Andres: super power: video
David: super power: communication
Bogdan: hard working person. New media and new tools are being used by more conservative groups. It‚Äôs sad. Want to change that and get more involved.
Manuel: create an alternative narrative for the city to mainstream media. Set up a newsroom, wikipedia style. Contribute with stories about the city.
Super power: project management
Xavier: super power: entrepreneurship, web development. Would love to see a platform where everyone can contribute but with a curated / edited side as a newsletter.
Jo: science teacher in Schaerbeek, WeBrussels, try to connect things that already exist.
Active in Indie media when it was still active (translate dutch and french), now "wereld morgen"
The bulletin: reaches expats in Brussels
Daar Daar: translate dutch articles into French

Xavier: hybrid where everyone can submit content, but need for a curated/edited version
Jo would love to translate articles in many languages
Andreea likes the idea 

We need a directory of all initiatives and their events / news.

Manuel: already worked with Reinventing Brussels to create an inventory of initiatives. Has a spreadsheet of citizen initiatives that he will share.

David: Place to show you alternatives being developed. Inspire me, how can I contribute? What events are happening?

Andreea: In copenhagen there was a website that compiled all the events from alternative left wings collectives, squats, youth houses, it was a calendar, nothing more. I was checking it all the time. Everything was in English. I envision this project everything around this calendar, organizations should have a profile, blog posts from them. Dukop.dk

Bogdan: StressFaktor in Berlin
monthly catalogue: al the pop up kitchen, demonstrations, free food, in English. Online and offline. 
There are a few gatekeepers in brussels that know what‚Äôs going on but we need to gather them.
Multiple languages can be confusing: translation or different content?
I miss the pop coolness of local media
Sometimes I disagree with Bruzz.
Mostly I disagree with Vice. 
I‚Äôd start from the narrative, not the audience

Andres: we need different points of views. If you want to create good content you need multiple points of views. Otherwise we create bubbles of people. 
Create a platform of communication between different spheres.

Jo: you can join an initative. In classic media it‚Äôs only initiatives once they already have an audience. What is happening before an initiative becomes "main stream". How can you be a participant, not just a consumer of media? Would be ideal to be translated but takes a lot of work.

Let people post in multiple languages and invite them to post it in at least two languages.

Narrative helps to make sense for people that are confused. They don‚Äôt know who to look for, need orientation, what can I do?

Andreea: Citizenship doesn‚Äôt mean left or right. There are right wing citizen initiatives.

Search for purpose
Call to action
distribute the power you create

Give the power to the reader whether they want curation

Bogdan
Interesting media in the world now:
Newsletters are very popular now
NextDraft: global news
The Skimm
Indie media: open channel, people vote
Huffington post: open channel, curated, op-ed, ‚Ä¶
Reddit
We are now going back to centralized, more curated. People need guidance and don‚Äôt trust algorithms.

Manuel: Open Governance process to select what gets published.

Andreea on how to get started: You go to the events of groups that are close to each other. 
The site was advertised at the events and asked the organizers to post so that the audience of other events could come too. It does only one thing and does it well

David: 95% of the events I go come from facebook. We need an alternative

Andreea: Need to be simple. Just an exposure platform. No way to RSVP, keep it simple. Just link to event page

How is it different? Citizen initiatives

Need tags
Event can be for a fee, but organization can be non profit.
Criteria of the organizer rather than at the event level

Bogdan: Bottom up process. Need to start with ecosystems that are already there. e.g. CinemaNova

Andreea: Need a place to direct them too.
Separate entry field for an event, have 2-3 examples. 

Manuel: like the idea of a MVP. Start small. Open source. Start experimenting with that thing. From discussions let emerge governance rule. 

Andres: need some informality. Add a link to Google Translate. Accessibility. English, French. 

Jo: some practical tool that we can continue building

Manuel will send the 200-300 initatives 
Open governance that is iterative
living document

Andres: let‚Äôs meet again

David: for next time, have a draft of events, as prototype. 
Circulate a google form to identify what‚Äôs happening in February.

Need to discuss more what is going to be listed there?
Grassroots not for profit citizen initiatives

Agenda for next time: define who we are, types of events listed.

Bogdan: for next time, each of us should come with an example of a new media we like, a mailing list, a magazine, what inspires us? What is our favorite media project? I can make a few slides of few examples.

Jo: how can we invite artists? How can we enable others to contribute?




--
David Prino

+32 (0)48 605 23 88
david.prino@gmail.com
Linkedin
Twitter

Longue vie a la Zinne!

Hey Xavier,

: can it be on Wednesday 13. February ?
: can it be at BeCentral, a room where we can use a beamer ?

Thank you Brussels chickens !

Jo

Zero Waste Cities

Manuel: already worked with Reinventing Brussels to create an inventory of initiatives. Has a spreadsheet of citizen initiatives that he will share.

David: Place to show you alternatives being developed. Inspire me, how can I contribute? What events are happening?

Andreea: In copenhagen there was a website that compiled all the events from alternative left wings collectives, squats, youth houses, it was a calendar, nothing more. I was checking it all the time. Everything was in English. I envision this project everything around this calendar, organizations should have a profile, blog posts from them. Dukop.dk

Bogdan: StressFaktor in Berlin
monthly catalogue: al the pop up kitchen, demonstrations, free food, in English. Online and offline. 
There are a few gatekeepers in brussels that know what‚Äôs going on but we need to gather them.
Multiple languages can be confusing: translation or different content?
I miss the pop coolness of local media
Sometimes I disagree with Bruzz.
Mostly I disagree with Vice. 
I‚Äôd start from the narrative, not the audience

Andres: we need different points of views. If you want to create good content you need multiple points of views. Otherwise we create bubbles of people. 
Create a platform of communication between different spheres.

Jo: you can join an initative. In classic media it‚Äôs only initiatives once they already have an audience. What is happening before an initiative becomes "main stream". How can you be a participant, not just a consumer of media? Would be ideal to be translated but takes a lot of work.

Let people post in multiple languages and invite them to post it in at least two languages.

Narrative helps to make sense for people that are confused. They don‚Äôt know who to look for, need orientation, what can I do?

Andreea: Citizenship doesn‚Äôt mean left or right. There are right wing citizen initiatives.

Search for purpose
Call to action
distribute the power you create

Give the power to the reader whether they want curation

Bogdan
Interesting media in the world now:
Newsletters are very popular now
NextDraft: global news
The Skimm
Indie media: open channel, people vote
Huffington post: open channel, curated, op-ed, ‚Ä¶
Reddit
We are now going back to centralized, more curated. People need guidance and don‚Äôt trust algorithms.

Manuel: Open Governance process to select what gets published.

Andreea on how to get started: You go to the events of groups that are close to each other. 
The site was advertised at the events and asked the organizers to post so that the audience of other events could come too. It does only one thing and does it well

David: 95% of the events I go come from facebook. We need an alternative

Andreea: Need to be simple. Just an exposure platform. No way to RSVP, keep it simple. Just link to event page

How is it different? Citizen initiatives

Need tags
Event can be for a fee, but organization can be non profit.
Criteria of the organizer rather than at the event level

Bogdan: Bottom up process. Need to start with ecosystems that are already there. e.g. CinemaNova

Andreea: Need a place to direct them too.
Separate entry field for an event, have 2-3 examples. 

Manuel: like the idea of a MVP. Start small. Open source. Start experimenting with that thing. From discussions let emerge governance rule. 

Andres: need some informality. Add a link to Google Translate. Accessibility. English, French. 

Jo: some practical tool that we can continue building

Manuel will send the 200-300 initatives 
Open governance that is iterative
living document

Andres: let‚Äôs meet again

David: for next time, have a draft of events, as prototype. 
Circulate a google form to identify what‚Äôs happening in February.

Need to discuss more what is going to be listed there?
Grassroots not for profit citizen initiatives

Agenda for next time: define who we are, types of events listed.

Bogdan: for next time, each of us should come with an example of a new media we like, a mailing list, a magazine, what inspires us? What is our favorite media project? I can make a few slides of few examples.

Jo: how can we invite artists? How can we enable others to contribute?
